question: Another dead place. I tol' you. Let's get out to the islands.
answer: The radio signals were coming from this area.

question: Not from the city. In every city it's the same. Dead. Let's get out to the barrier islands. If there are survivors sending those signals that's where we'll find them.
answer: Plenty of time for the islands. The rest of our...life...on the islands...I think. We gotta see if there are others here. We came all this way. We're gonna check it out.

question: Ptoooo! Nothing! Dry as a bone. No gas. Let's get outa here.
answer: Check them all. And check the tanks under the pumps. HELLO. IS THERE ANYONE THERE? HELLO.

question: It won't happen to him! It won't happen to him! You heard his prayer. His prayer will save him. He could never become one of...one of those... devils.
answer: Prayers have no power to save. The knife can save. It can cut the disease away. The bullet. It can shatter the brain where the evil takes seed. These are saviours...our new saviours...our only saviours.

question: We must wait. One day the curse will pass. One day a dead man will... will...
answer: One day a dead man will refuse to return, and that man will be a saint. The first saint of our century. That's a prayer, too. A catechism. Something the priests tell us to believe.

question: You can believe this, Miguel. I'll kill you if you shoot. We must wait. I'll....I'll do it....I'll do it myself....when it needs to be done.
answer: No. You won't be able to do it. He will rise. He will rise and you... you will die.

question: No. You won't be able to do it. He will rise. He will rise and you... you will die.
answer: It looks uninhabited. What do you think?

question: I think we should burn the church. Kill the priest and burn the church. It's the only way. The only way.
answer: I'm pullin' in.

question: DATURA!!! DATURA!!! MIRA. DATURA!!!
answer: What's he saying? His madness....could be from shock.

question: No. I didn't stop the infection in time. I know. Don't worry. When he dies, I won't be like Maria. I'll shoot him.
answer: DATURA!!! DATURA!!! DATURA METEL!!!

question: No. No shooting. Not until we're sure we're alone on this island.
answer: No. No, thank you. No ice. Straight up, please. No ice. Thank you. NO ICE, I SAID!!! NOOOOO ICE!!! Burn the church. Kill the priest and burn the church. Burn....

question: What is it?
answer: I dunno. Landing pad for a helicopter? I dunno. It's some kind of....elevator. There must be something under the ground here....maybe....military.

question: Look.
answer: What do we do? Let'em know we're here....or what?

question: Let's just....wait a minute. Get a better look. OH, MY GOD!!!
answer: It can't be. Are we truly in hell?

question: Yes...yes, do it...please...you can't let me die this way...please. Destroy me. A bullet...in the head...I don't want to become...one of...one of them.
answer: Take his weapon, Tyler. Take his gun, ass hole. He still has the strength to pull a trigger.

question: Please...senor...destroy me...one bullet...please.
answer: Maybe. We'll have a little talk first. Then....maybe...I can help you out. String him up. They can handle it, Tyler. You've been buckin' for a shit detail lately so here's one you're gonna love. We've got two dead. Cut the heads off and get the bodies underground to the refrigerators. Fast. It's a hot day. Tyler. Just our men. Not him. His head stays where it is. He and I never really had the chance to get acquainted. When he comes back...I'll get another shot at it... Ha ha ha ha...

question: Please....shoot me.
answer: And if I don't? If I don't you'll come back after your death. You'll come back and find yourself hanging there...wanting to eat...needing to eat human flesh. You hate that thought, don't you? That's the ultimate sin for most of you fools, isn't it? After hanging up there a few days you will be mad for food...crazed! You will lust for it! YOU WILL BE WORSE THAN ANY OF THEM!

question: NO...NOOOOOOO...SHOOT ME! SHOOT ME! SHOOOOOOOOOT MEEEEEEEEE!!!
answer: I'll bargain with you. How many of you are on the island?

question: Two of us...only two of us...me...and him.
answer: I don't believe you, rebel. Where are your headquarters? On the mainland?

question: The mainland...is dead...a dead place...nobody there...
answer: Where are your headquarters, rebel? Tell me or I'll let you hang there forever...FOREVER!

question: There are no...headquarters. There are no...rebels. Only the walking dead. Don't you see. They have won.
answer: Then why did you come here?

question: To look...look for a place...a place to live in...an empty place...a... new...place...
answer: How did you know we were on this island? Do others know? Will others come?

question: Nooooo. Believe me. There are no others...no rebels...nobody...it's over...it's ooooo....
answer: Where are you going, Tyler?

question: Where are you going, Tyler?
answer: My..."detail", sir. We're going to bury the heads.

question: No time for that. I'll take care of them.
answer: Just....following procedure, sir. They're entitled to burial.

question: I said, I'll take care of them. Just leave them there. Go help with the rest of the gear. WHO FIRED THAT SHOT? WHO FIRED THAT SHOT? Goddammit, somebody's gonna tell me who fired that shot or I'll have every last one of you chopped up for feed!!! Step up here, Tyler.
answer: Sir!

question: You fired that shot, didn't you?
answer: No, sir.

question: Let me see your weapon. It's been fired.
answer: In the battle, sir.

question: It's alright. It's alright. Don't be afraid. We're friends. There are soldiers near here. Guards. I'll take my hand away if you won't scream. Right. We better get away from that Bee. He might have friends. Bees. That's what we call the dead... the walking dead...here on Gasparilla's island.
answer: Gasparilla?

question: He was a pirate who sailed these waters long ago. His name is bein' borrowed these days by the long lost Henry Dickerson.
answer: Governor Dickerson? Of Florida?

question: That's the man. He's been holed up here ever since the shit hit the fan. Him and his family owned these islands 'round here. They was leasin' this one to the Fed. The whole underneath is dug out. There was missiles here and laboratories and bomb proof housing, nuclear power, all o' that. Now this is Dickerson's....Gasparilla's... private fortress. Him and a bunch o' his cronies from all the best golf courses in Tallahassee...and his private army, of course.
answer: We ran up against a platoon of soldiers. There were actually walking dead...in uniform...with guns.

question: Captain Rhodes and his Red Coat Bees. They could sting, sister. We know you came up against 'em. We been watchin' you since you landed. Couldn't help. I'm sorry for that. We ain't supposed to be outside. If we was spotted it could....well, it could be the end of everything. Give that to me. Get behind me. Stay behind me.
answer: Thanks. I can fight my own battles.

question: I know you can. Like I said, we been watchin' you. We found nine entrances to the Cave so far, and we ain't got the whole thing near charted yet. That's what we was doin' out here today. Huntin' for entrances.
answer: The man I was with...until today... believed that praying was for blind men who couldn't see the truth.

question: How we gonna break the curse without a prayer or two.
answer: Curse?

question: What is it if it ain't a curse?
answer: It's a disease. It's a...a bug...a parasite that infects the brain.

question: That sounds like a curse to me.
answer: We thought we were escaping here. We thought we'd found an uninhabited island. Christ! This place is a worse nightmare than anything I've seen yet!

question: I'm sure that's true, miss. And that's why we're doin' what we're doin'. What's happenin' underground here is just what Lucifer planned for this sinful race o' man. But we're gonna beat Lucifer. We're gonna put an end to what's happenin' here.
answer: Oh, what did I run into? A bunch o' Jesus nuts? Religiosos? Prayer won't stop a bullet from one of those storm troopers and prayer won't keep one of those monsters from eatin' your liver for lunch.

question: That's why we didn't use prayers on this here white coat 'til after he was destroyed. We ready to fight when we have to. And we gotta fight now.
answer: Look. I BEEN fightin', mister. I been fightin' for what feels like a hundred years and I'm finished. I don't need religion. I don't need prayers. I need a couple guns and a couple hands. We can sail on outa here. Find another island where there ain't so much....traffic.

question: You think you can find your boat? There's a thousand little inlets and backwaters all through here. You remember all the ways you turned to get where you are now? You leave yourself a trail? We didn't see the exact spot but we know about where you landed. But we ain't ready to take you there. Not yet. You see...we need guns, too.
answer: I can find it myself. I didn't come that far.

question: Farther than you think. You'll get lost. You will. And there's Bees all through the jungle. I ain't lyin' to ya. Religiosos don't lie.
answer: No. They just try to hold you for ransom. Fuck you, Moses! I'm outa here!

question: We don't need her guns that bad. Billy boy. We'll split up. Billy, you go with Spider. Just an hour or two tonight, that's all. Rhodes might have extra guards on after all the commotion. We'll meet up at number six and go back home together.
answer: Are you gonna pause to say words over the dead this time or can we be on our way?

question: This is Mary Henried. Did anyone enter the dormitory?
answer: Take it, friend. Take it. It's a present. From me to you. Just remember who gives you favours. Well, Bub. I've heard about you. Miss Henried's pride and joy. Surly sonofabitch. I want to make friends, Bub. Friends. I have one more goodie in my sack here. Come, come, Miss Science. You've seen worse.

question: God....damn you, Rhodes!
answer: God has damned us all. Are my atrocities worse than yours?

question: You have ruined weeks of work here! We've been trying to wean these specimens onto alligator meat!
answer: No wonder they're so....hungry.

question: No wonder they're so....hungry.
answer: I didn't realise! Those were de-caps! I didn't know that....de-caps... revived!

question: Any dead whose brains are intact will revive.
answer: But...we bury the heads. Oh. God! It must be torture for them!

question: They are brutes without feeling. Though I admit that I've requested cremation for myself. Burial is an archaic tradition, even more ridiculous now than it ever was. To say nothing of the...spacing problem...on a small island like this.
answer: I thought the purpose of decapitation was to...to...

question: You can't run away from the planet, Miss Science. You can't even run away from the island, heh heh.
answer: Leave me alone, you...COCKSUCKER!!! You're....you're disgusting! You're....FILTH!

question: And you're the one who builds the bomb and they says, 'I hope it'll never actually be used'.
answer: Julie Grant is a behaviouralist. She's not medical. She hasn't been as...exposed to...to things...as some of the rest of us. She'll be alright. I'll talk to her. She'll be alright.

question: Oh, I have no doubt.
answer: If you put her on the shit list because of her reaction here tonight I'll go to Dickerson.

question: Ah, yes, our noble Gasparilla does seem to favour you lately. I understand he assigned you a roommate of your choice. The rest of us have to pick names out of a hat.
answer: Rhodes, you and I had a roll in the hay together when I first got here. It was a wholly unsatisfying experience which I do not want to, and which I never will repeat! So give up, mister! I'm going home...to that roommate you mentioned. Take your hands off me! Right now!

question: Maybe you'll change your mind when it starts getting too lonely for you. I'm not entirely without influence myself, Miss Science. I had your roommate assigned...by Gasparilla... to my platoon. What's his name? Tyler? Yes. Toby Tyler. I had an unfortunate little run-in with him today. In fact...you might say that Mr. Tyler is in big trouble with the...authorities.
answer: You better not mess with me, Rhodes. I'd love to serve your balls to those Red Coats for lunch! Think about it!

question: No, Miss Science. You're the one who needs to do some thinking.
answer: Toby...thank God...wait here. I gotta find out what's goin' on.

question: Toby...thank God...wait here. I gotta find out what's goin' on.
answer: Hey. Slow down. What is it?

question: Some of Rhodes' men. At the door.
answer: That bastard. I didn't think he'd make his move so fast.

question: It's because of me.
answer: Oh, bullshit, Mary. It's because Rhodes is a prick.

question: I want you to leave. Then maybe...
answer: We're both gonna leave. Leave the island. I've been talkin' to Tricks. We think we can smuggle out one of those inflatable rafts. They're crated up real small. They've got air canisters. There's food inside. Even a little motor.

question: I am not...a guerilla fighter, Toby. I'm not a pioneer. I'm not...I'm not strong that way. I need...
answer: Need what? Civilised order like we have down here? Christ!

question: I can work here. Maybe my work can help...help everyone. I can do more good with access to this equipment than I can off in some wasteland.
answer: For the good of mankind. That's what every monster-maker says. We're gettin' out. Me and Tricks. I want you to come with us. I want that more than anything. I'll send word. I'll let you know a time and a place to meet. We probably won't be able to wait around so if you're not there on the dot...well...if you're not there, I'll know you're not comin'. I don't know what they're gonna do to me. I figure they'll just send me out to Stalag Seventeen but if...if it's worse than that...Tricks will know. Stay in touch with Tricks.

question: Sir. It's quite clear that...
answer: SHUT UP, MISS HENRIED! I TOL' YA B'FORE!

question: THIS IS A TRAVESTY! CAPTAIN RHODES IS...
answer: SIDDOWN, YOUNG LADY! I DONE YUP A SHIT-LOAD Now I think Captain's punishment is fair, considerin'. In fact I think you ain't got shit ta complain about.

question: I'm sorry, General, if I...spoke out of turn. It's just that...Mr Tyler is not here to defend himself. He has no representation. I don't believe due process is being served by...
answer: Listen, Missy. I am the only due process that has ta be served aroun' tyere and one of the people doin' the servin' from now on is gonna be you. Now you been prancin' aroun' the Cave like yer ass was glass fer long enough! All that's gonna change, young lady. Now if you still got a statement you'd like ta make, you can jus' hold onto it 'til tonight.

question: Tonight?
answer: That's right. 'Bout eight, if that suits. We'll start out in my gymnasium an' progress on from there...to various other forms o' physical therapy. Oh, Lordy, Lordy...I'm drunk as a skunk. Look at this...will ya jus' loooooook at these lovelies! Say, Henried, you ever try it with another woman? I've tried it with boys. Too strenuous. Folks...I just couldn't resist. How d'yall like those? How do those taste? Fresh from the freezers, folks. It's what...THEY...EAT! Just kiddin' folks. Just kiddin'. Would I do a thing like that? I ask ya now, would I? Hah ha ha ha ha... The great state of Florida. People came here fer years ta die. Retire and expire. The rest o' the country used ta think we was nothin' but a bunch o' farts and fogies. Hah! Now this here's the new Capital o' the World! Hah! They came here...died...went to hell...and the Devil sent 'em back as an army. Hah! General Gasparilla's army...MY ARMY!

question: We think there are other cities surviving. We think maybe Detroit... there's some signalling out of Philly.
answer: There's no place like this place. Warm climate. This facility. Christ, there ain't nothin' like this no-damn-where! Even the Feds knew that. That's why they stored so much o' their shit down here. It's all mine now. All mine. Just let 'em try ta come after us down here, which they will some day...take a likin' ta what all we got an' come after us. They'll hafta get past my army! An army that ain't afraid ta die...ha ha ha...'cause it's awreddy DAID! HA HA HA

question: It's not a very big army. And small as it is you won't be able to continue feeding it for very long. We've got to find ways of getting them to respond without relying on...
answer: You'll find the ways, Miss Mary. And when ya do...we'll sail on over to the mainland...or any other damn mainland fer that matter...and start us a recruitin' program. There's millions o' Bees out there jus' waitin' fer' a General ta lead 'em on ta vict'ry! Well, hi there, y'all.

question: He's just finding another reason for bumpin' us off. Don't ya see. He needs us ta die. He needs our bodies.
answer: It's alright. I'm a friend. I need help and so do you. What's a safe place to talk?

question: Ain't no place safe.
answer: Look...I know you have no reason to trust me. I've got friends in the Cave. I got some stuff comin' out this mornin'. I'm gonna try to get off the island. I'm gonna have this stuff sent over to the hospital...

question: The hospital?
answer: Yeah. My stuff's all marked with red crosses so nobody gets too nosey. Meet me at the hospital after the supplies come in. Maybe we can find a place there to talk.

question: Maybe.
answer: Hey, Tricks. Some detail they got you on.

question: Hey, Tricks. Some detail they got you on.
answer: Not as bad as yours, pal.

question: What'dya get?
answer: Rafts. Two 38s. A little ammo.

question: We need fuel, and a couple automatics.
answer: Hey, you. Those two on the bottom. Don't open those yet. They might be from the wrong shipment. Just keep 'em around 'til I can check.

question: Give him a chance. What'dya tell that soldier, soldier? You tell him we was rebels?
answer: He's my contact for Chrissake! There's two crates. Can you get me into the hospital? There ya go. Complete with air canisters...little motors.

question: We got a boat.
answer: What?

question: I say we got a boat. Can you get other stuff?
answer: I got some fuel comin' out and, I hope, some automatic rifles.

question: It won't work. That's pure nitro you're dealin' with there. That stuff can blow if you look at is funny. What're you gonna do, walk into the Cave carryin' those tubes on feather pillows? You don't have a complete layout of the place. Even if you manage to avoid a fight you won't know where to go.
answer: We're hopin' you can show us where ta go, Toby.

question: Oh, no. I'm tryin' to get off this island alive. I'll help you all I can but I'm not goin' in there on a suicide mission. What can you hope to accomplish? Some radios maybe? A supply room or two? You'll all be killed and in a few weeks they'll be back to business as usual. That place was built to withstand nuclear attack! What are you gonna do with a half-dozen guns and a few sticks of nitro?
answer: We're gonna blow up the powder magazine.

question: What?
answer: We know what's down there. We did the loading' and unloadin' when the stuff came ashore in the early days. A direct hit oughta do more than a few weeks worth o' damage.

question: A direct hit'll blow the top off this whole island! How're you gonna fuse the stuff? How're you gonna leave yourself time to get out?
answer: If we don't get out it's a small price to pay.

question: You're fuckin' out of your minds! There's two hundred people down there. You gonna murder two hundred people?
answer: Sinners! Animals! Filth! Doing the work of the Devil!

question: What about the people here in the camp? If they don't get blown to kingdom come their food'll be destroyed, their water, medical supplies. They won't have any more power. This island can't support them all, they'll be doomed. Count me out, friends. I'm gonna get my ass outa here. Anybody wants to come along is welcome. I wanna see Rhodes burn just a much as you do...but all those people. We don't have the right to be their judges... just like they don't have the right to be our judges.
answer: We know what we must do. It's written for us in the Bible. "They shall be driven from the land of the living down to the world of the dead. That is the fate of those who care nothing for God."

question: Toby's right. They're not gonna sit around with their fingers up their asses while we bust up their toys.
answer: Datura.

question: What?
answer: Datura Metel. The Devil's Trumpet. Don't worry. I ain't goin' religioso again. It's a flower that grows on these islands. Where I come from the voodoo priests used it whenever they needed a Mickey Finn. It's toxic. Ground up you can put it in a drink or inject it...or...in a sealed area it might be introduced through the ventilation system.

question: Datura! Miguel knew it! Datura, he was shouting! Datura Metel!
answer: We always planned to use it. We got some ground up already...but we could never find enough.

question: Maintenance shafts run behind all the main rooms. Nobody's in those at night. You can use them to get around in. Hit the power governors first. Kick a surge into their computer network and you erase everything stored in the memory. Then...over in here...that's where the cages are...
answer: I coulden stop 'em, boss. No way I coulda stop 'em, I sweah. They tie me up and stick dis... ...they stick dis in my mouf. You b'lieve dis?

question: Jesus! They're gonna try to do it! They're goin' in! They got somebody to help 'em from the inside!
answer: They din' get da pistols. You know dem pistols you buddy send in widda raffs.

question: Don't move! Open the outer door. Move it!
answer: ENOUGH! ENOUGH! ENOUGH! ENOUGH!

question: What...what is this? Who...?
answer: It's alright, it's alright, my dear. You've simply helped us do the Lord's work.

question: What...what have you done to her?
answer: God forgive us. Forgive us the pain we inflict as surgeons. We'll be in Heaven, child. Soon. We'll be with Him in Heaven. NO YOU DON'T I CAN'T LET YOU DO THAT! I CAN'T!

question: Tricks! What's going on?
answer: Toby's in the Cave. We're gonna make our move. There's rebels out to blow the powder magazine. Come on. Come with us.

question: Where are you goin' out?
answer: Exit five.

question: See ya there.
answer: SEVEN MINUTES, MARY. EXACTLY SEVEN MINUTES!
